snippet: The easing was portrayed as part of an effort to strengthen the fragile government’s authority by permitting it to purchase light weapons.
abstract: United Nations Security Council votes unanimously to temporarily rescind part of 21-year-old arms embargo on Somalia; action is part of effort to strengthen fragile Somalian government's authority by permitting it to purchase light weapons.
lead_paragraph: The easing was portrayed as part of an effort to strengthen the fragile government’s authority by permitting it to purchase light weapons.

headline.seo: Somalia Arms Embargo Partly Lifted by U.N. Security Council
headline.main: Security Council Loosens Somalian Arms Embargo
headline.print_headline: Security Council Loosens Somalian Arms Embargo
